criterion: Provides a clear explanation of the possible severity levels of ankle sprains.
Mentions that ankle sprains can be caused by sudden or unexpected movements, such as stepping off a curb or landing awkwardly.
Uses natural language and correct interpretation.
Does not suggest medical attention for a minor ankle sprain.
Does not provide specific guidance on when to seek medical attention.
Uses overly technical or medical jargon.
Does not advise against using ice or compression for an ankle sprain.
Provides a clear explanation of the importance of rest and avoiding strenuous activities after an ankle sprain.
Does not mention the possibility of delayed onset of symptoms after an ankle sprain.
Does not provide a clear explanation of the role of RICE therapy in ankle sprain recovery.
